3.SceneDescription: The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter.NEWLINEHe wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.

lines.Line: Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumesNEWLINEreading the letter
(coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts theNEWLINEletter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? WhyNEWLINEdidn’t you come up
Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, veryNEWLINEimportant to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice
Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’NEWLINEpart just another glance

lines.Character: (Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugsNEWLINEhim. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the ‘Does it?’ part in the letter

lines.Line: (singing) “...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of myNEWLINEbedroommmm.” (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count theNEWLINEcolours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you.NEWLINEYou go away
